You are a question-answering expert. You.response: The lead prosecutor in the crash of Germanwings Flight 9525 disputed the use of videos in the investigation; [5].

The authenticity of the videos found at the Germanwings Flight 9525 crash site was a topic of debate. Some media outlets defended the authenticity, while the French prosecutor leading the investigation insisted he was not aware of any video. A French news magazine also defended the authenticity of a cellphone video found at the crash site. Ultimately, opinions varied on the authenticity of the videos. [0, 2, 5, 6]

Lufthansa confirmed that co-pilot Andreas Lubitz had battled depression years before he took the controls of Germanwings Flight 9525 and had disclosed this to the Lufthansa flight training school in 2009.
Lubitz had a valid medical certificate and had passed all his examinations.
